intro: Cuphea spermacoce, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive, velvety, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Botanically, it belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological features.
